transcripts.text: A friend who was down there this weekend, she was posting on social media.  It looked like a lot of fun.  Everybody out and about.  Explain how they're working this.  I can see all the tables there behind you.

Yeah.  Yeah.  Yeah.  So two things are happening.  First of all, this area really kind of lends itself to the outdoor dining because of the piazza that they built a couple of years ago.  Take a look at this thing.  And I mean, it's already tailor made for the restaurants for outdoor dining.  So that's one thing that they had going on.  But you mentioned the health department and the health department ended up.  You know, while they ended up closing down a lot of restaurants, as they started reopening, they started changing the rules on reopening because of social distancing, which means that they are now, the county health department, allowing these restaurants to move tables into the sidewalks and streets.  And that is what happened over the weekend.  And by the way, at 5 o'clock, we'll get some of that video for you because it's pretty cool.  I mean, it's the whole area has been shut off.  This is the piazza, but the streets up there are the areas that were shut off.  And basically this whole area was one big party.  And the video shows that everybody's behaving themselves.  It looked like everybody was kind of keeping their social distance on and all that kind of thing.  But once again, it's one of those deals where they say we have to survive somehow. And that food hall is like one of those, it's like an upscale food court.  It is exactly what it looks like.  And there's a variety of restaurants in there from Asian to Mexican to seafood.  And it's just absolutely amazing.  Of course, you've got the beautiful fountain here.  No swimming or playing in the fountain, by the way.  When the kids come, keep them out. And all you have to do is take your camera... Point your camera at that thing, and suddenly the menu pops up.  You can actually do everything off the menu, including pay your bill. First of all, Sam, hello.  How are you?
I'm well.  How are you, Dan?  Nice to see you.  Thanks for coming down.  Thanks for giving Little Italy a shout out.  We all really appreciate it.

Well, tell me how things are going.  And first of all, you have a beautiful charcuterie here that Miggy was immediately attracted to, of course, and a beautiful flatbread pizza.  These are a couple things you guys have.

I was going to say, because obviously this piazza is just so beautiful.  Let's take a look at this while we're talking for a second.  But the piazza is just so beautiful.
